RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 1 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 61. Maiden Special Weight Purse 29400. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED MAIDENS, THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 118 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: VAGABOND VIRGIN engaged in close chase through the backstretch, raced off the rail on the turn and dug in under steady handling to get up the final yards. B. J. MOOSE took the lead on the chute and moved to the inside to set a clear pace, was pressured at the rail on the turn, dug in under steady encouragement leaving the turn but was caught in the final yards. KARMA BUS chased inside and raced close at the rail on the turn, ran evenly to late stretch but flattened nearing the wire. ALDARIGHTTRICKS gave close chase through the backstretch, rounded the turn in the three path then flattened. JUST JUBA gave chase while saving ground. RAISE A RUCKUS ducked out and made contact with MALEKES MAGIC leaving the gate then gave chase, rounded the turn about the four path and showed little in the lane. The latter was bumped leaving the gate and never factored.

ENTRY.NAME: Karma Bus
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased inside,close rail turn,evenly to late lane,flattened

ENTRY.NAME: Vagabond Virgin
ENTRY.COMMENT: close chase,off rail turn,dug in lane,up final yards

ENTRY.NAME: B. J. Moose
ENTRY.COMMENT: clear pace inside,pressured rail turn,dug in lane,caught late

ENTRY.NAME: Raise a Ruckus
ENTRY.COMMENT: ducked out,bumped break,chased,4p turn,little in lane

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 2 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 83. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 32700. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, WAIVER CLAIMING, RESTRICTED OR STATE BRED RACES OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $25,000. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since June 22 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since May 22 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $25,000 (Races Where Entered For $20,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SOMEDAY IS TODAY stalked off the rail the first turn, picked up the chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole, raced off the rail on the far turn and dug in from the head of the lane to take over the final yards. BABY MAN took a quick lead and rated the pace inside, came under pressure toward the three eighths pole, contested the far turn near the rail and dug in through the lane, but was caught in the final yards. LACE REVOLUTION settled off the rail on the first turn, bid into the backstretch, rounded the far turn off the rail and finished well to clear third later yards. AZZURRA saved ground off the pace, picked up the chase past the seven sixteenths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn then flattened in the lane. OCEAN LILLY saved ground close to the early pace, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn about the three path and weakened. BACKSTREET AFFAIR raced in the three path the first turn, gave chase nearing the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn at the rail and showed little more.

ENTRY.NAME: Baby Man
ENTRY.COMMENT: quick lead,rated pace inside,pressured 3/8,rail turn,caught late

ENTRY.NAME: Someday Is Today
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked off rail,chased 7/16,off rail far turn,up final yards

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Schiano Racing Inc. & Carpe Diem Syndicate

ENTRY.NAME: Lace Revolution
ENTRY.COMMENT: off rail,bid past 1/2,off rail turn,clear 3rd late,finished well

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 3 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 66. Claiming Purse 8700. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE JULY 22, 2022. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since July 22, 2022 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000 (W V A Races Not Considered In Eligi bility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: WEST VIRGINIA PAM rated a slim early lead inside, came under pressure leaving the three eighths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn and just lasted all out. BOCA BIRDIE saved ground well off the early pace, started a bid past the three eighths pole and steadily improved in the three and four paths on the far turn, dug in for second mid-stretch and just missed in a strong finish. CHANNEL SCENT settled off the rail on the first turn, bid leaving the three eighths pole and raced at the rail on the far turn, ran evenly to mid-stretch but flattened later yards. SO RED THE ROSE stalked the early pace off the rail, gave chase from the three eighths pole, raced off the rail on the far turn and weakened in the lane. MAP EM UP stalked from the three path the first turn, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn in the three path and flattened stride. MOJO MATTERS raced well off the early pace in the three path and never factored.

ENTRY.NAME: Boca Birdie
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground,bid past 3/8,3& 4p far turn,strong finish,just misse

ENTRY.NAME: West Virginia Pam
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated slim lead,pressured 3/8,rail turn,just lasted,all out

ENTRY.NAME: So Red the Rose
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked off rail,chased 3/8,off rail far turn,weakened

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 4 7F Dirt CR: 77. Allowance Purse 30500. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since May 22 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: HESSICA moved to the inside and rated a slim early lead, dug in to the challenge of Cousin Winnie leaving the three eighths pole and cleared that one past the pole, raced at the rail on the far turn and held well under steady handling. SOMEBODY LOVES ME saved ground well off the pace, picked up the chase into the backstretch, improved off the rail on the far turn and cleared second mid-stretch. COUSIN WINNIE stalked two deep, challenged toward the three eighths pole but dropped back past the pole, rounded the far turn near the rail and flattened in the lane. BREADMAN'S ROSEBUD saved ground well back from early contention, gave chase leaving the half mile pole, raced near the rail on the far turn and finished evenly to close the gap. GILDED QUEST stalked the early pace three wide then faded through the backstretch. Beautiful And Bold broke through the gate before the start, ran loose a few laps and was a late scratch.

ENTRY.NAME: Hessica
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated slim lead,urged clear past 3/8,rail turn,held well driving

ENTRY.NAME: Gilded Quest
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Ronney W and Richie Rich Racing Stable

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 5 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 59. Maiden Special Weight Purse 29400. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 118 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: PHANTOM QUEEN broke clear and tapered in to set a pressured pace, raced at the rail on the turn and was steadily handled to increase her lead. SCARLET REBEL was bumped at the break then pressured the early pace, raced in hand leaving the three eighths pole, resumed chase into the turn but settled for second. MEGEEZER came away awkwardly and made contact with Scarlet Rebel, gave chase through the backstretch, raced in the three path on the turn and came along for third. VERY VENUS gave close early chase inside, rounded the turn at the rail then flattened in the lane. KNOBIESMAGICSONDE lunged and ducked out at the break, gave chase leaving the chute, rounded the turn in the four path and showed little in the lane. LUZIA was shuffled back leaving the gate, gave chase through the backstretch, raced in the three path on the turn and passed some rivals in the lane. UNALTERED gave chase outside, rounded the turn about the six path and showed little in the lane. BIT OF BLESSINGS was forced in at the break and never factored. AUNT TOOTY gave chase, raced in the five path on the turn and weakened. CAJUN CASHEW was bumped leaving the gate, gave chase inside, raced at the rail on the turn and weakened.

ENTRY.NAME: Scarlet Rebel
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped break,pressed early,in hand from 3/8 to 1/4,settled 2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Phantom Queen
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke clear,tapered in,set pressured pace,rail turn,widen driving

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 6 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 71. Claiming Purse 17500. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $10,000, For Each $1,000 To $8,000 1 lb. (W V A Races Not Considered In Eli gibility)(Races Where Entered For $6,250 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: LADRO DI FICHI saved ground off the pace, started a bid leaving the seven sixteenths pole, raced off the rail on the far turn then eased out entering the stretch and dug in to get up the final yards. ARROWWOOD saved early ground, bid leaving the seven sixteenths pole and took the lead in the three path entering the stretch, dueled briefly clear inside the sixteenth pole but was caught in the final yards. KATALIMA steadied at the rail into the first turn and raced well off the pace leaving the turn, bid approaching the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn about the five path and came along for third later yards. BEST VIRGINIA saved ground, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole and took the nod between horses past the quarter pole but was met into the lane and weakened the final sixteenth. SWEET FACTOR exchanged contact with JACCACI leaving the gate then rounded the first turn in the four path, gave chase leaving the three eighths pole, came through the far turn at the rail and could only improve her position. The latter exchanged contact with Sweet Factor leaving the gate, rounded the first turn off the rail and showed little response through the backstretch. BROADWAY PEGGY rated close inside, gave chase leaving the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn near the rail and weakened. LADY CINCO DE MAYO came away awkwardly and rounded the first turn in the four path, picked up the chase nearing the three eighths pole then faded through the far turn. WINDSOR'S PLAY took over and angled to the inside to set the pace, came under pressure leaving the seven sixteenths pole, was met at the quarter and faded through the far turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Ladro Di Fichi
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground,bid 7/16,off rail turn,eased out 1/8,up final yards

ENTRY.NAME: Best Virginia
ENTRY.OWNER: O'Sullivan Farms LLC and Conrad Randall R

ENTRY.NAME: Katalima
ENTRY.COMMENT: steadied 1st turn,bid 7/16,5p far turn,along 3rd later yards

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Robert G. Leavitt S. CHARLES TOWN RACE 7 7F Dirt CR: 96. Stakes Purse 75000. FOR REGISTERED ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA BRED THREE YEAR OLDS. $50 nominations close Wednesday, July 12, 2023. $50 to enter with a purse of $75,000 Added. Entries close Wednesday, July 19, 2023 by the usual time of closing. The added monies and all fees to be divided 60% to the winner, 20% to second, 11% to third, 6% to fourth, and 3% to fifth. Weight: 122 lbs. Field will be limited to ten starters with up to four alternates. Preference to those horses having accumulated the highest career earnings at th e time of closing of entries. Trophy to the winning owner.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: LITTLE ROO ROO broke outward then rated the pace inside, shook off the challenge of Juba's Notion past the five sixteenths pole and was hand ridden to widen at the rail on the far turn, came under pressure into the stretch and held on well. PAYMENGOLD settled off the rail on the first turn, started a bid leaving the three eighths pole, improved at the rail on the far turn, cleared second passing the eighth pole but was no match in the lane. JUBA'S NOTION raced with the early pace two deep, challenged nearing the three eighths pole but dropped back past the five sixteenths and flattened in the lane. GRUMPY'S BUDDY settled inside then gave chase leaving the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn at the rail and showed little in the lane. ROAD MINISTER steadied leaving the gate, raced off the rail on the first turn and never factored.

ENTRY.NAME: Little Roo Roo
ENTRY.COMMENT: came out break,rated pace,pulled clear 5/16,asked 1/8,held well

ENTRY.NAME: Paymengold
ENTRY.COMMENT: off rail,bid 3/8,rail far turn,cleared 2nd past 1/8,no match

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 8 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 68. Claiming Purse 14100. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE JANUARY 22, 2023. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since January 22 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. (Race s Where Entered For $4,000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CENTERFOLD ANGEL raced with the early pace three wide, took the nod toward the seven sixteenths pole and raced clear nearing the five sixteenths, came under pressure into the far turn, rounded the turn at the rail and was steadily handled in the lane. THUNDERTURTLE saved ground, picked up the chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole, raced two deep on the far turn then dueled through the stretch to take the nod for second. EMMA AND I saved ground racing well back from early contention, started a bid toward the three eighths pole, entered the far turn near the rail, angled to the six path through the turn, dug in through the stretch but missed the nod for second. SHERIFF'S KID raced with the early pace two deep and between horses, gave chase into the backstretch, rounded the far turn at the rail then flattened the final sixteenth. SOCIAL EXCLUSION rounded the first turn about the five path, picked up the chase from the seven sixteenths pole and raced in the three path of the far turn, then weakened in the lane. MISS WILD raced off the rail on the first turn, gave chase toward the seven sixteenths pole, came through the far turn in the three path and showed little in the stretch. CICI UNIFIED raced with the pace inside, was met approaching the seven sixteenths pole and gave chase from that point, but weakened at the rail on the far turn. ONEPRETTYTHING rounded the opening turn about the six path and showed little response through the backstretch. SHEMADEMELUCKY dwelt then ducked out leaving the gate and rounded the first turn in the four path.

ENTRY.NAME: Cici Unified
ENTRY.COMMENT: with pace inside,met 7/16,chased,weakened rail far turn

ENTRY.NAME: Miss Wild
ENTRY.COMMENT: off rail 1st turn,chased 7/16,3p far turn,little in lane

ENTRY.NAME: Centerfold Angel
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Ronney W and Shake and Bake Racing LLC

ENTRY.NAME: Thunderturtle
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground,chased 7/16,2d far turn,dueled stretch,nod for 2nd
